if this is the glass lens here we put

so the trick is that this red line is a

to a shorter object on the image plane
here so this is very normal right far

so if we change things around a little

through this whole optical system so
even though each one of these objects is

length of the lens are set up such that
only a select bundle of these Ray's gets
through and if you put the aperture
right at the focal point of the lens
it's very specific in selecting these
rays to only come from parallel rays

different distances away from the lens
they're both spraying light out in all

the point where it's only looking at the
Rays that are coming in parallel so they

telecentric and hyper centric lenses are
useful hyper centric because if you have
a conveyor belt going by and you want to

nice to have a lens that can look around

sides of the objects at the same time
without moving the lens around that's
that's useful and then also if you're
